intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium alpigena, commonly known as alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium alpigena is often found in meadows and mountainous areas, contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
